column4: hello friends, i would like to set up a logitech mx1000 but i cant, help plz
http://adventuresinswitching.blogspot.com/2008/04/logitech-mx1000-mouse-on-ubuntu-804.html

the 2nd link shows how to add an option to the usb module
if you make one, it will be obeyed
use: sudo -i   instead
do you use an nvidia or ATi GPU?
mmm thats a hard question
help me find out whats my driver plz, i use to watch it in the additional driver manager, now is not there
try:  sudo lshw -C display
what is your GPU?
intel corporation is the vendor
gotcha, they usually just fly
im nvidia?
is it nvidia or is it intel. Or do you have that hybrid graphics nonesense
product: Mobile 4 Series Chipset Integrated Graphics Controller
just intel is the vendor, it doesnt said nvidia
i still cant get ubuntu 3D to work , what can i do?
do you use dual gpu/hybrid graphics, or is it just an Intel GPU?
just an intel, my laptop is a lenovo
not sure then dude, could read /var/log/Xorg.0.log   to see what's what
I always do a clean install of the new release rather than upgrade, seems to help avoid issues
how can u do that without losing your info and configurations?
backups, easy
